alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 5:22AM AKST until February 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Snow and blowing snow will cause briefly low visibility. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...Now to noon Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...North winds gusting to 40 mph will persist through Saturday morning. These winds will cause very cold wind chills and blowing snow with briefly low visibility. The coldest wind chills and lowest visibility will be in the Bering Strait. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
